etymologies: early 19th century: from French troupiale, alteration of American Spanish turpial, of unknown origin

definitions: a gregarious songbird of the American oriole family, typically having orange and black plumage and yellow eyes.

notes.text: Genus Icterus, family Icteridae: several species, in particular the tropical American Icterus icterus

shortDefinitions: gregarious songbird of American oriole family
